author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 13-year-old boy from Chengam near Tiruvannamalai was injured in the leg after he was hit by a bullet. He has been admitted to Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital (RGGGH) for treatment.

Sathya Das, of Theertandipet in Chengam, is studying VII standard in a government school in his village. He lives with his mother Vasuki and father Pandian in the village and has an elder brother. On Sunday evening, he went to the farm to check the water flow. “We were also behind him. All of a sudden, we heard a gun shot and my son fainted. We were in a state of shock and could not do anything for a while. We then rushed him to the RGGGH,” said Kasturi, speaking to The Hindu.

She suspected the hand of poachers.
title: 13-year-old boy suffers gunshot wound
